title: >-
  Pittsburgh Post-Gazette says it will close down, citing losses and labor rules
  - The Washington Post
---
<p>After exhausting legal avenues in a losing labor battle with unionized employees, the owners of one of the nation’s oldest newspapers have decided to shut it down.</p>
<p>The 240-year-old Pittsburgh Post-Gazette is shutting down following a protracted labor battle and court rulings favoring its union.</p>
<p class="rw-outer-content"><span>Some content could not be imported from the original document.</span> <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2026/01/07/pittsburgh-post-gazette-closure/">View content ↗ </a></p><figure></figure>
<figure><img src="https://pl.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?"/></figure>
<figure><img src="https://pl.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?"/></figure>
<figure><img src="https://pl.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?"/></figure>
<p>The newspaper will print its final edition May 3, according to a statement it issued Wednesday hours after the U.S. Supreme Court <a href="https://aboutblaw.com/bkA9">denied</a> its request to stay a federal appeals court’s November order that the newspaper adhere to the terms of an earlier labor agreement with its union.</p>
